lead_paragraph: ACCIDENT TO THE STEAMER ISAAC NEWTON.On Tuesday evening, the large steamer Isaac Newton, Capt. Wm. H. Peck, left her wharf at Albany, having on board several hundred passengers, who were principally from the Western part of the State, and very anxious to reach the city yesterday morning, but were sadly disappointed, inasmuch as tile noble craft ran high and dry upon a sand bar opposite Red Hook, Dutchess county, N.
